channel.title: Blog posts on Digital Land
channel.description: Recent content in Blog posts on Digital Land

item.title: Kicking off the Planning Permissions project
item.author: Emily Robertson-Knowlton
item.description: The Digital Land team at the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government (MHCLG) is working to make it easier for people to find, access and trust the data underlying England’s housing market. Access to reliable data on where planning permissions have been granted, rejected and built out is an important part of this work. That’s where the mySociety team come in – we are collaborating on a Discovery and Alpha project, to research, prototype, and test ways to make data around planning applications more open, accessible, sustainable, and trustworthy.

item.title: Data and Information
item.author: Paul Downey
item.description: Based on our learnings from discovery, this is the first in a series of blog posts that explains the points of friction that our users face when trying to use housing data.

item.title: Making developer contributions open and transparent
item.author: Matt Lucht
item.description: How we’re working with planning policy people, local authorities and suppliers to evolve minimal data standards for Section 106 agreements and Viability assessments.

item.title: Introducing user research to housing and planning data
item.author: Rose Rees-Jones
item.description: Our approach for user research during the discovery phase.
